content: 1 the cowldana by deirdre liston its mash up time the cowldana neck-warmer is a mix between a cowl and bandana this perfect little wrap around accessory will keep you cosy and warm while not being too bulky or stifling to wear cowldana neckwarmer © 2022 me i knit all rights reserved photos and pattern are the property of deirdre liston me i knit and may not be altered shared or sold you may sell finished products using this pattern but please give design credit to me deirdre liston & @me_i_knit 2 method flat knitting skill level beginner the cowldana neck-warmer is knitted flat samples were knit using malabrigo mecha yarn in the colour taystee & arco iris 100g 119m/ 130yds 1 full skein is required for the neck-warmer you will need to reuse the yarn from your gauge swatch of course you can knit this cowldana using whatever type of yarn you desire just keep in mind that your final measurements & gauge may vary from what is stated here in the pattern one size fits all finished measurements width excluding tassels 72cm / 28 length 30cm / 12 please read the pattern in full before starting your project gauge 15 sts x 25 row unblocked in 10 x 10 cm / 4 x4 garter stitch using 8mm us 11 needles or needle size required to meet gauge materials  8mm us 11 knitting needles  darning needle  stitch marker  cardboard 15 - 18cm / 6 - 7 width for making  scissors tassels abbreviations  k knit  st s stitch es  k2tog knit two stitches together decrease a stitch  kfb on the left needle knit into the front of the stitch without dropping it off the needle knit into the back loop of the stitch slip the stitch off the left needle increase a stitch  rs right side of work  ws wrong side of work cowldana neckwarmer © 2022 me i knit all rights reserved photos and pattern are the property of deirdre liston me i knit and may not be altered shared or sold you may sell finished products using this pattern but please give design credit to me deirdre liston & @me_i_knit 3 instructions cast on 3 stitches using your preferred cast on method row 1 knit all sts ws row 2 knit to last st kfb rs repeat row 1 & 2 until you have increased to 42 sts row 3 knit all sts ws row 4 knit to last 3 sts k2tog k1 rs repeat row 3 & 4 until you have decreased to 3 sts bind off and leave a 6 tail to weave in ends tip 1 if you are like me and knit mindlessly not paying attention to what row you are on use a stitch marker at the end of your work where the increase & decrease occur tip 2 try slipping the 1st stitch on every right side row for a neater
